action.action-desc: Mr. Steube (for himself and Mr. Donalds) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 with respect to certain security registration thresholds, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the More Accurate Metrics in Securities Law Act.

subsection.text: Section 12(g)(1)(A) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78l(g)(1)(A)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: within 120 days after the last day of its first fiscal year ended on which the issuer has—

subclause.text: a class of equity security (other than an exempted security) held of record by greater than a number of beneficial owners determined by the Commission by rule; or
market capitalization exceeding an amount determined by the Commission by rule, and

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on the date that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
